review_body: We booked in for two nights, but had to return one day early to Melbourne because of the corona virus. We paid $800-plus for the two nights.We did not ask for any refund, which we were given, without asking, when we had stayed at the budget hotel Ibis Styles Kyoto Station for eight nights, reduced to two beause of our holiday shortened by the virus.Our corner room at Hamacho Hotel was large and well fitted out, although the king bed was rock-hard. We loved the ultra-new bidet, with the toilet seat automatically lifting when you entered the bathroom. Excellent walk-in shower adjacent to the bath.It was a Friday night and we chose to eat in the hotel restaurant. It's named Sessions -- should be renamed Short Sessions. The restaurant was dark and our table was 'lit' by one artiifical candle. Our obliging waiter shone his iphone light on the menu. We had arrived at 8.15 and the waiter informed us that the kitchen closed at 8.30. We hurriedly ordered the fish special -- snapper with scallops. It was smothered in a sauce that defies description. Totally inedible. The worst fish meal we have ever endured -- and we eat fish at least twice a week. We think the waiter took pity on us: the two sakis we each had were not added to the bill.The staff were friendly enough, but one of them said we could push our heavy luggage to the 'nearby' airport bus station. Luckily we ignored his advice.

The only negative I could possibly ascribe to this hotel is that the room is a bit small. The location is also not optimal - it's about a fifteen minute walk to the nearest metro station, which is itself rather far from many tourist attractions in Tokyo. That said, the Airport Bus stops only five minutes away from this hotel, which is a huge plus. That said, everything else in this hotel more than makes up for that. The wifi in the hotel works great, and while the room is small, it is extremely cosy and comfortable to live in. The breakfast and the restaurant at this hotel are also very good. Overall, given how affordable this hotel is compared to other hotels in Tokyo, I have absolutely no reservations in giving this hotel five stars, and heartily recommending it to any traveler, in spite of the two minor points above.

Hotel Hamacho is close to 3 metro stations and TCat. From Narita you can take the Limo bus to TCat and walk 5 minutes to the hotel, even with big luggage it is easily manageable. As you get off the bus facing the building, turn left and walk down the street over the track for 300m, then you will get to the main street, cross it and walk another 200m and the hotel is right there.Hamacho station is the closest of three stations nearby, it has the Shinjuku line (green color) that u can take directly to Shinjuku station. You can also connect and go to Tokyo station from Hamacho station.The other two stations are further maybe 15 minutes walk and it goes directly to Asakusa and Shibuya. U can use the Line to connect with Ginza line.Now about the hotel, we booked two regular rooms, and they are small. It is the same size as a inside cabin for a cruise ship. The bathroom is also small, you can’t fit two people inside. However their toiletries provided were excellent and the shower pressure were one of the best we experienced. If you want a bigger room, when booking look for a different category. I think it called corner room.Staffs are super friendly. Laundry facility, $300 yen for a wash and $100 yen for dryer located in the 4th floor.If you are sensitive to noise ask for a room not facing the street. Both of room face the main road and we can hear train noise and siren once in a while since the police station is nearby. It didn’t bother us since we were so tire each day out sightseeing. The breakfast varieties doesn’t changed much. They offered Japanese and Western style, but after 3 days you don’t want to eat it anymore. There is a bakery next door, grocery store and lot of places to eat nearby.Internet is strong and good.

Booked this hotel for my wife and I, we stayed for 7 nights. The hotel is beautiful, lovely room, excellent staff, both at reception/breakfast/room cleaning. Fabulous toilets and would stay here again A******

Getting to the hotel from the airport bus stop was a breeze. From the main entrance where the bus stops don't enter the building. Just turn right (if facing the bus) and walk a few hundred metres. The hotel is on the left, opposite side of the road. No need to take a cab. The room is clean and comfortable with all the basic amenities you need. Staff is friendly and helpful.The three metro systems are within walking distance. A supermarket is just opposite the road where you can also choose from a variety of bento meals where discounts would be offered later in the evening. To the right of the hotel after the traffic light is a Chinese restaurant which serves authentic Chinese food. We had a takeaway the first night and returned twice.

Staff were very knowledgeable and friendly. They helped us with directions to tourists and making dinner reservations.The room itself was a bit small but rooms in Tokyo are expected to be small. Good location with a grocery store across the street.

I chose this place because it was reasonably priced and a short walk from the Tokyo City Air Terminal(TCAT).I had never been to this part of Tokyo in my many visits to the city. I was very pleasantly surprised.First off if you fly into Haneda Airport (which you should try to do) you can take a limousine bus that goes directly to TCAT. This will run you 850 yen and take about 30 minutes. When you get to TCAT head left out the terminal door once you enter the terminal. Walk straight for about 5-7 minutes. At what I think is the third traffic light (I might be wrong here) turn left and in another minute the hotel will be on the left. If for some reason, you have too much luggage to manage the short walk, a taxi there will run 420 yen and take a few minutes of travel time. There is no such thing as an early check-in. You can check your bags and come back later if you arrive early. I was able to get to my room at 2:00 PM which is an hour earlier than the official time. In the meantime you can walk along the Sumida River (turn left as you leave the hotel and walk around three minutes or around Hamacho Park (turn right as you leave the hotel and walk around 4 minutes). The park is on your right.There are numerous small restaurants and cafes in easy walking distance. Right across the street is the large Peacock Supermarket open 24 hours a day. It has a large an interesting array of food if you need to save some cash. It also has a couple of microwaves available so you can heat up your purchases if desired.The hotel itself is no more than a year old. It does cater for the foreigner (at least half its guests). Staff have either good or at least serviceable English. The place including the rooms is spanking clean. My room itself was Tokyo compact without a great deal of storage. However the room is laid out cleverly so that it doesn't feel claustrophobic like some other equally rated Tokyo hotels. For one person it is quite comfortable. For two it might be a mite cramped, though if you are going to be out most of the day it shouldn't be a real problem. Otherwise larger, more expensive rooms are available.Since Sunday, many of the cafes and restaurants are shut I did have dinner with a friend at the hotel restaurant. The room is nicely set out and is quite comfortable for a leisurely dinner. Prices are moderate and the food is quite good. Otherwise there is a breakfast buffet for 1800 yen. Didn't try it since I depended on the supermarket for breakfast needs. (There is also a boulangerie just two minutes away - left as you leave the hotel). The hotel also hosts a craft chocolate shop and offers guests a free sample chocolate. All chocolate is made within the shop. The offerings are hot chocolate, coffee and decadent looking desserts.The area seems populated with young families many of whom have young children. So for those traveling with children, this hotel and area may appeal.

My friend and I spent seven nights it this beautiful hotel! The building itself is precious and our room was very nice and cozy. We got an amazing bargain and ended up paying very little for this luxurious place! We’d definitely go back. As there’s always a little bit of a room for improvement anywhere one can go, in this case we would have like a more continental breakfast as well as a few English-speaking channels on the room television. No biggie...

What a great find this hip hotel in a quiet area of downtown Tokyo was! It is across the street from a supermarket and in easy walking distance of public transport. Service is friendly and efficient, the dinner in the restaurant was excellent (we did not have breakfast though so cannot comment on that) and everything was brand new and super clean. The minimalist design is stunning. Very good value for money, but utilise the opportunity soon as this new hotel is going to become very popular. I can't wait to stay there again!

Recently visited for a 2 week vacation during the Rugby World Cup. The hotel is in a fantastic location, close to numerous subway stations & a quieter part of the city. The hotel itself is true boutique, with solid service throughout. Housekeeping were excellent, the hotel was spotlessly clean, with the daily service in the room also. They have a washer dryer too on the 4th floor which was very convenient. The breakfast was very good with numerous buffet options & super cool decor with assorted jazz records & posters. As a hotelier by profession I give this hotel 5 stars for value, overall experience & I would definitely return....kudos & "ARIGATO"!!! :)

Came in late October from a belated birthday vacation. Stayed here for a few days while touring in Tokyo. The room is small, but extremely well laid out. Very clean. Well designed. Staff are wonderful and we had no problem conversing with staff in English. Hotel is in an excellent location, close to subways, great walking neighborhood, felt very safe at any time of day.Very deep bathtub, and was great for soaking after a log day of wondering around Tokyo. Restaurant on site was good, and their custom chocolate shop is 'to die for' . I think I spent over 100$ in varying chocolate sampling in a few days.My only very minor negative is the room didn't have a safe, and the balcony isn't accessible

Absolutely fantastic hotel, especially for Tokyo standards! Super cool design, good quality beds. Well done customized furniture. Windows can be opened. Excellent room climate. Rooms small, as always in Tokyo. Book a higher category for more space. Pillows a bit hard, but they provide softer ones upon request. All around a great hotel. Amazing bakery next door (Django). The location is not exactly famous, but conveniently close to Tokyo station.

We booked a corner room. What a room! This is by far the best room we’ve stayed in over many visits to Tokyo. The room is huge, with a super king sized bed, floor to ceiling windows on both corner sides, light and airy and new and shiny. We loved it. I would recommend this room to anyone, I don’t think this can be beaten for the price. We had a deal with breakfast included, well worth it.Location wise it’s in a quiet (for Tokyo) area. Plenty of shops and restaurants within a 10 minute walk. On arrival from Narita we got a taxi from Tokyo station for ¥1400 which was well worth it for the door to door service when loaded with cases. There are three underground stations within a 10-15 minute walk, no problems getting anywhere.We will be staying here again.

This was my second visit to Tokyo. This hotel is great. We stayed for 5 nights. II am so happy I was able to book a room at a reasonable price. I stayed in room 1314 (13th floor) for two people / two separate beds. I would advice you to come.The positive:1- Convenient location. Three metro stations nearby (5-7 minutes walking). Although there are no Japan Rail nearby. For JR you have to walk 18 minutes. 2- Sparking clean, specially the room and the toilet. I must congratulate the cleaners working on the 13th floor.... Thank you so much!!3. No noise in the room... the walls are insulated. 4. Very fancy toiletries included. 5. The front desk team do their best to help you in any request. I particularly must mention Paku and Hayashi (thank you both for your help!!!)6. The beds and particularly the Japanese pillows are SUPER comfortable... (I ended up buying two pillows online to take with me to Australia).7. Elevators are fast and never had to wait for long.8. Very nice breakfast, although please read below.The negative:1. The breakfast in the restaurant include a great selection of food, however several things are missing:a) Please include oatmeal and FRESH fruit in the buffet (not fruits submerged in sugar or any type of liquids)b) There was one day when no orange juice was available. This was unacceptable in a breakfast buffet.c) Make sure croissants are also ALWAYS available. One day there were a short amount of croissants. d) You should include a special take away breakfast order for guests departing before 7 am.

We had a really great stays here! The room was fresh, clean and had tons of natural light from the outside. The entire hotel felt new and sparkling clean everywhere. It's in a great location, and you can reach all of Tokyo easily with multiple train options. After it was all said and done...we couldn't believe the value we received vs cost for 5 days! We would happily return. Thanks!

We stayed the first 3 nights of our 3 1/2 week trip around Japan and we could not have wished for a better place to stay. As soon as you walk in the main door, the smell is divine. The staff were all super lovely. The room was small but was designed in a way that you did not feel cramped. The room and hotel was very clean and the room had everything we needed, kettle, fridge, there was 2 bottles of water each day, the shower was great with lovely toiletries. It was also our first experience of heated toilet seats!!! Which I have to say, I still cannot get used to!! Lol . We had hoped to end our trip there when we return to Tokyo at the end on October but the prices are more expensive which is a shame. Also, the area is wonderful too with many restaurants & plenty of supermarkets. I cannot recommend this hotel & area enough.

Myself and my girlfriend stayed in Hamacho hotel for 3 nights whilst visiting Tokyo for the Rugby World Cup. It’s a very modern but stylish hotel, rooms are basic but do have lots of charm. Loved the lobby area was really cool and also the bar is really nice . Breakfast is not amazing but does the job .Its location is good if you want to be off the beat and track a bit and also happy to take the tube a few times . Aside from that it’s great!

I stayed here 4 nights in late September 2019. The hotel is immaculately clean, the decor sleek and minimalist, and room very comfortable. Service at the front desk was always helpful and they didn't even charge me a penalty when I needed to amend my reservation at the very last minute. The only downside was the location, with the train/subway stations being approximately 1 km from the hotel (10-15 minute walk). Would definitely return to this hotel.

The hotel is new and makes a first great impression. We first booked the corner room and if you like space, like we do, you should definitely book the corner room or the bigger categories. We had a change of plans and stayed for two more nights and had to move to a standard double room which is really really small. The hotel is located close to two different subway stations, one of them takes you directly to Shibuya (15 mins) and the imperial palace (5 mins). There are loads of great restaurants close to the subway station! We would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for 7 nights. The location was great with a maximum 10 minute walk to 3 train stations and the Toyko City Air Terminal. There were 2 supermarkets a 2 minute walk away.I had a Double Room which was small but comfortable for a solo traveller. Very modern and clean. Free daily bottle water. Coin laundry also on site.Front of house reception was very helpful and quick to action an incident I encountered with my room.I had 2 meals at the hotel restaurant "Sessions", which I couldn't fault.Also there is a sumo stable, a 5 minute walk away. You can stand outside in the morning and watch practice. After practice, they came out for photos.Overall, a great experience.

On my recent holiday to Japan, the Hamacho Hotel was the first hotel I stayed in.The hotel is very clean, tidy, and modern.I was impressed with the room and loved the bathroom accessories, which were very handy.However, the best feature of this hotel is the stafff at the front desk.Always polite, friendly, and have a smile on their face. Service was second to none.It was pleasent to be greeted with a "good moring", a smile, and a bow. I felt very welcome and comfortable whilst staying here.on our first day, we asked a nice woman on the front desk the best way to get to Tokyo Station.She advised us of a free bus, which stopped directly at the station after only a couple of stops.After walking to the bus stop, she came running up to us to advise us of what time the bus would be arriving. She went above and beyond what we expected.The staff at the front desk also helped me and my dad plan the best route to our next destination, which was Shin-Fuji station.If I (hopefully!) return to Tokyo, I'd love to stay at this hotel again, and for longer than my recent three nights.

2 stops to Tokyo Station on the subway, some nice restaurants nearby and lots of stores. Room very clean and reasonable size , would recommend. Staff very nice and friendly.Probably stay again if going through Tokyo.

We stayed in a semi double room, the space is enough for two people. We had 2 big luggages n 2 hand carry, which made the space more limited. Close to suitengume and ningyocho metro stations. Close to few shops e.g 7 eleven, peacock (24 hours). The best thing is it's very close to the bus terminal that can transport you to narita and haneda airports (discount price:1,900 yen per person). Average 25-30 mins to other areas e.g shibuya, asakusa etc. No iron provided. No closet for us to hang our clothes. The window is huge and you can see everything outside the hotel, which is great especially for claustrophobic people. The male staff at the counter gave us the wrong info on the checkout time (prolly miscommunication: not fluent in english), and we ended up paying additional 1000 yen charged for late checkout.
user_name:
katijahsulaiman
Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam

review_body: This hotel offers good value for money in terms of comfort (especially the bed and pillow), cleanliness, good breakfast with Japanese and Western selections, and amenities. For the chocolate addict, there is Nel on the ground floor selling crafted chocolate. Nearby, there is Seijoishi supermart and Django boulangerie. It is close to Ningyocho with many small eateries and shops, the established Nihonbashi, and the Sumida River where one can take a morning or evening stroll.Will definitely recommend it to friends visiting Tokyo.

The hotel was conveniently located. Shibuya, akihabara, tsukiji and sensoji temple, were all within 30 min. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was very friendly and they spoke english. Breakfast was not diverse, but it was really good.

Fantastic hotel - brand new, great location .Staff extremely friendly .Been in many hotels over Japan during the years , this is definitely the best .Great value for money also .Metro station is just 5 minutes away, Greta resturants all around and coffee shops

This was my first hotel stay in Japan. Rooms are small but in good order. Service was good. Enjoyed one buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant - nice variety of things to try. I wish they would let you go out on the guest room balcony; the door is blocked. But this is apparently the norm in Tokyo for “safety”.

Spent 5 nights here. Hotel is really new and opened just a few months ago. Their website is fantastic for tourists, especially the "Access" page which outlines all of the subway exits you should take that are closest to the hotel. If you're trying to get here via Taxi, the english website also has the address in Japanese so you can show that to your driver. So helpful! It's also conveniently located near the the Tokyo City Air Terminal which is a big bus station with affordable routes to all of the airports. We were able to walk to the air terminal upon departure with two 50-pound luggage suitcases and get on a bus that took us directly to Narita with no issues. Staff was always friendly and super helpful. Bathroom was spacious, no knocking things over while you get ready like those tiny APA hotel bathrooms. One day, I had the Do Not Disturb magnet pinned on my door and they left a shopping bag near my door with 2 towels, water bottles, and amenities since they were unable to clean my room. That was SUPER nice! Never experienced that before at a hotel. The only negative is lack of irons/ steamers for clothes. Unlike American hotels that have an iron in each room, you have to request for one at the front desk. They don't have many irons at Hamacho and I had to wait for one to be available (which never happened during my stay). So, be prepared to pack clothes that don't require ironing!

Love this new, stylish hotel. Great interiors, decor and plants everywhere. My family and I enjoyed the Japanese style and continental breakfast for 10 days. The room is zen minimalist but with complete amenities. The toilet and bath is big and modern compared to other Japanese hotels. 24/7 Grocery right in front. Great dining choices around the Ningyocho Station and Shin Ohashi Dori Ave. Sumida River is just a few blocks away. Nice walk to people watch and dog watch. Great jogging area too.

We stayed at the Hamacho Hotel for 5 nights and everything was absolutely great.Pros:- Price/value considering Tokyo is so expensive. In the Hamacho you get the feeling you are in a very luxurious hotel for 1/5th of the price of the big 5 star hotels.- The rooms are tastefully decorated and the beds are very comfortable- Good location - not far from the city center at all (15 min walk to Ginza, 15 min tram to Shinjuku).Cons:- The bar and restaurant close quite late and there is no place to have a little night cap at the end of a long day.

I felt like we were in New York staying at this hotel! The rooms were compact but purposeful ;) Everything was so new and clean. The service was fantastic too!In terms of location, once you get the hang of trains, you'll be fine! There are two stations that are walking distance to the hotel - which made it easy to get around ;)

Super nice hotel. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are a decent size (for Tokyo). Super clean. I believe it's a new building (and it shows). Nice little neighborhood. Sort of quiet. Feels like you're not in Tokyo. Get a burger at Brozers. Well priced.

Fantastic hotel. Great very comfortable beds and sparkling clean washroom. Breakfast was delicious and catered to Japanese people. You get a true Japanese experience. Don’t expect an omelette station or cereals all over. If you want an American breakfast go somewhere else.

We stayed there for a week, and I had booked a twin room. Unlike other reviews, we did not get an upgrade. After having read that, I feel I should have asked for one...Our room was one with a little garden patio, but the sliding door only opens a few inches so you cannot actually go outside. The hotel has the picture of our room as "ツインルーム". It works as a double room or as a twin room, but I feel it should only be booked for singles, as there is very little room.We both had average carry on roller bags and had trouble finding space to put them. There are no drawers or shelves that are big enough to put anything larger than a water bottle.There was a small fridge in the corner, which was nice, but I think this once, I would have preferred shelves.There were no stands for our suitcases, nor was there a desk or chair- there wouldn't have been any space for it. There was a wooden construction along the wall with the TV that had 5 hangers, and a small shelf (about 4 inches/ 10 cm deep) to put toiletries etc on. The room was very clean, well lit, with outlets by each side of the bed. The room has a small sitting area along the window, and a small table with it, but it's really not a desk.The hotel doesn't have a fitness center or pool.There are washers and driers on the 4th floor, and soap is provided. I don't remember what the cost was to do laundry.They clean every day and change towels and sheets very often (too often?)The restaurant serves a nice breakfast (see pictures), Japanese style and western style. You must purchase your coupon at the front desk before sitting down if it's not included in the room. Adults about $20, kids (12 and under) about $10.They close breakfast at 10 am sharp, and sometimes they were a bit slow or reluctant to refill some of the buffet items. I recommend getting there earlier rather than later. The food was fresh and tasty.The hotel is near Hamacho, Ningyocho, and Suitengu Subway stations, very well located and in a nice, local neighborhood.I was very happy to find such a nice place for about $80 per night.

We stay here on my birthday and they upgrade my room to the corner room which is very kind of them. We really love this hotel so we came back to stay here for 3 more nights.The staff is friendly and happy to assist you. The room layout was nice, facilities and amenity in the room are fully equipped.The location was great 10 minutes walk to Suitengumae station or Hamacho station. Easy to find a restaurant around the hotel.Overall, the service and comfort level of this hotel was fantastic. Will definitely stay here again for my next Tokyo trip.

We stayed here for 4 nights whilst in Tokyo in April. Such a great stay, the hotel is kept spotless with lots of amenities in the room. The maids brought us fresh towels each day and left them outside our room as we had the do not disturb on. Hotel is in a good location opposite a 24/7 supermarket and 5/10 minute walk to 2 separate metro stations and about 20 minutes to the centre of Tokyo. Would stay here again.

New Hotel with excellent rooms with a gardens outside each room, excellent amenities, very nice / friendly staff, nice location. We booked a semi-double room and were really surprised when Hotel staff provided us with a doble room corner (which is expensive for at least twice) without any additional money, as this corner room was free that day.We wish to stay again in Hamacho Hotel Tokyo!
